brief.content-text:
The animation depicts V LAN broadcast traffic. A router is connected to three switches, one each on Floor 1, Floor 2, and Floor 3. The switch on Floor 3 is connected to three servers. The switch on Floor 2 is connected to three clients. The switch on Floor 1 is connected to three clients.

The Accounting V LAN comprises one server from Floor 3, one client from Floor 2, and one client from Floor 1.
The Marketing V LAN comprises one server from Floor 3, one client from Floor 2, and one client from Floor 1.
The Engineering V LAN comprises one server from Floor 3, one client from Floor 2, and one client from Floor 1.

When packets travel from the router to the switches, they are switched and traverse to the destined V LAN.
